docs.snippet: If there's a blizzard of ads falling on Hollywood, it must be the homestretch of the Oscar campaign....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ad season is reaching the shrieking stage -- Vote for our movie or we will annihilate a bunch of defenseless kittens! -- so it seemed like time to step back and do a little deconstruction.
docs.abstract: If there's a blizzard of ads falling on Hollywood, it must be the homestretch of the Oscar campaign.

docs.snippet: "Babel" is the frontrunner, but it hasn't broken with the pack....
docs.lead_paragraph: Why is "Babel" not the frontrunner in this race? It is the most ambitious film, has a stellar cast, won the Golden Globes dramatic nod and most important of all, has the most nominations, with seven.
docs.abstract: "Babel" is the frontrunner, but it hasn't broken with the pack.

docs.snippet: Eddie Murphy, as Norbet, undermines Eddie Murphy's Oscar hopes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sometimes, having your nominee all over television is precisely what you don't want. The airwaves are getting squished by a big old blob of "Norbit" right now, and the ads serve as a constant reminder that, while Eddie Murphy sparkled in "Dreamgirls," his career decisions have mostly been driven by that which folds and goes in his pocket.
docs.abstract: Eddie Murphy, as Norbet, undermines Eddie Murphy's Oscar hopes.

docs.snippet: The Oscar-winning actress Charlize Theron was sued yesterday by the Swiss watchmaker Raymond Weil. The company claims that she breached her endorsement contract by wearing a rival manufacturer’s watch. In papers filed in State Supreme Court, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Oscar-winning actress Charlize Theron was sued yesterday by the Swiss watchmaker Raymond Weil. The company claims that she breached her endorsement contract by wearing a rival manufacturer’s watch. In papers filed in State Supreme Court, the Weil company claims that Ms. Theron signed an endorsement deal in which she agreed that from October 2005 to December 2006, she would wear only Raymond Weil watches. The lawsuit claims she was photographed at a film festival in Austin, Tex., on Mar. 14, 2006, wearing a Christian Dior watch. A spokeswoman for Ms. Theron did not return a call for comment.

headline.main: Manhattan: Actress Sued Over Watch Choice
headline.print_headline: Manhattan: Actress Sued Over Watch Choice

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, Feb. 7 — The El Paso Corporation, the largest American natural gas pipeline operator, agreed today to pay the federal government $7.73 million to settle allegations that it was involved in illegal payments under the United Nation...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, Feb. 7 — The El Paso Corporation, the largest American natural gas pipeline operator, agreed today to pay the federal government $7.73 million to settle allegations that it was involved in illegal payments under the United Nations-run oil-for-food program in Iraq.

headline.main: Pipeline Company Settles Charges Involving Iraq
